intro: Sloanea sipapoana, commonly known as the Madagascar sloanea, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the eastern rainforests of Madagascar. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically clustered in axillary or terminal inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are often dispersed by wind or animals.
